text: [Music]
hello I'm Kartika a cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Dallas
customer tell me that when an AWS DMS
task encounters an error they wonder if
they can control or change the behavior
of the replication task during change
data capture CDC face I tell them that
they can do this through error handling
setting error handling setting can
manage errors at the data level or table
level either based on the data
manipulation language DML or based on
the environmental errors environmental
errors include connectivity issues
between the replication instance and the
source a target to ask failure due to
resource contention on the replication
instance the source a target is not
available and so on let me give you
three common error handling task
settings
the first one is table error policy when
an error is related to general data or
metadata to a specific table this policy
defines the action that a WSDL mistakes
for example whether to suspend the table
or to stop the task the second one is
data truncation error policy when data
is truncated during migration this
policy defines the action that the AWS
di mistakes for example whether to
ignore the record lock the error in the
log file suspend the table or stop the
task third one is recoverable error
count when an environmental error occurs
this policy defines a maximum number of
atoms that AWS DMS makes to resume the
task automatically for example -1 is for
infinite attempts and 0 is for no
attempts you can use any number for this
for more information about this see the
link provided
let's go ahead and perform the steps
involved in modifying the task setting
to set error handling setting using a
double use command line interface sign
in to the AWS management console and
choose AWS DMS
choose a database migration task from
the navigation panel if the task that
you want to modify is running select the
task choose actions and choose stop
after the tasks stopped choose the name
of your task
from the overview details section expand
the tasks setting JSON section
copy and paste a town setting into a
JSON editor editor sitting under error
behavior the following example
setting set fail on transaction
consistency breached to true and rick
herbal error count to ten
save the JSON file and note the task
Aaron and file paths to use later
install and configure the latest version
of the aw CLI if you haven't already run
the modified replication task command
with the task a RN and a file path that
you noted in step 8 Linux example
windows example
return to the AWS DMS console and choose
database migration tasks from the
navigation panel confirm that the task
status is modifying choose the name of
your task
from the overview details section for
your task expand task setting JSON and
conform to the error behavior settings
are updated
hope you enjoyed watching the different
error
setting in a wsdls
thank you for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
you
